data.title: Unassuming Greek star of the Convention
data.meta_description: When asked to name the ‘big’ personalities on the European Convention’s agenda-setting praesidium, most would plump for its chairman, former French President Valéry Giscard d’Estaing or his two dep…
data.text:
When asked to name the ‘big’ personalities on the European Convention’s agenda-setting praesidium, most would plump for its chairman, former French President Valéry Giscard d’Estaing or his two deputies, Jean-Luc Dehaene and Giuliano Amato, both former prime ministers. But another, relatively less well-known member has, it seems, emerged as the one to watch.

Step forward, Giorgios Katiforis, representative of Greece, which currently holds the EU’s rotating presidency. According to ‘our man on the inside of the praesidium’, Katiforis is a bit of a dark horse. “He doesn’t say a great deal,” says our mole, “but when he does, everyone sits up and takes notice.”
